name: Felix Leiter
description: CIA agent and close ally of James Bond.

content.title: Background
content.body: Felix Leiter is an operative of the United States Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and a recurring ally to James Bond. Introduced early in the Bond novels, he often provides intelligence support and assistance with cross-national operations.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Leiter is portrayed as laid-back yet competent, representing the professional ally rather than a competitor to Bond. Their friendship is based on mutual respect, cooperation, and a shared goal of combating global threats.

content.title: Role in Story
content.body: In 'Casino Royale' and other stories, Leiter aids Bond by providing intelligence, local contacts, and backup during operations. His presence symbolizes international cooperation between British and American intelligence.

content.title: Relationships
content.body: Leiter shares a strong friendship and professional rapport with James Bond. He acts as a liaison between MI6 and the CIA, cooperating with M and other agencies to counter terrorism and espionage threats.

content.title: Skills and Abilities
content.body: Felix Leiter is skilled in covert operations, firearms, and interrogation techniques. His American intelligence background complements Bondâ€™s British training.
